meanings.definition: To make someone feel intimidated or apprehensive.
meanings.sent1: The dark alleyway can be quite dauting for young children.
meanings.sent2: The challenging test dauted the students before they even started.
meanings.sent3: The tiny kitten found the big dog dauting, but they soon became friends.
meanings.sent4: The towering skyscrapers dauted the small town below.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunderstorm was dauting to the scared puppy.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel overwhelmed or discouraged.
meanings.sent1: The long list of chores was dauting for the tired mother.
meanings.sent2: The difficult project dauted the inexperienced team.
meanings.sent3: The idea of running a marathon seemed dauting, but she decided to try.
meanings.sent4: The steep mountain trail dauted the hikers with its twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The huge crowd at the concert was dauting to the shy singer.
